title: Jeremy Corbyn and John McDonnell to quit if Labour loses next election, says shadow chancellor
text:
Jeremy Corbyn will quit as Labour leader if he loses the next election, shadow chancellor John McDonnell has revealed.

The veteran MP said he too would resign his front bench position and ruled out standing in a leadership election, in an interview with GQ magazine.

Speaking to Tony Blair's former chief spin doctor Alastair Campbell, Mr McDonnell was asked if it was possible for Mr Corbyn to stay on as party leader if he lost a general election for the second time.

The shadow chancellor replied: "I think it is the same for my own personal position, I can't see so.

"What we'd do is as the tradition, which is have an election for a new leader.

"I'm still of the view now that whoever comes after...
description: Jeremy Corbyn will quit as Labour leader if he loses the next election, shadow chancellor John McDonnell has revealed.
